name: Hotel de Londres Eiffel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed at this hotel as part of our Rick Steve's tour. The location is wonderful for accessing Metro and bus plus a few short minutes walking distance to Eiffel Tour. Many good restaurants nearby too. The staff at the hotel is extremely friendly, all speak english, and are very helpful for assistance. Very clean rooms and good breakfast.
reviews.title: Great location...great service!

reviews.text: We had 2 rooms at this hotel. Ours was a room on the top floor with a view of the Eiffel Tower (top half of it over the french rooftops). Wonderful room, wonderful view. Smallish of course, but that's what nice old buildings in Paris are. Only a minutes walk to the tower, and watching the light show each hour after dark from your own Paris rooftop room is pretty magical. There's something very beautiful about a traditional French rooftop. The staff on the reception desk were very accomodating and helpful in a 'French' manner (there's always that slight feeling of... can't quite decide if it's condescention or disapproval...!), but that's all part of the charm of Paris. It didn't spoil it for us, we were amused by it. The only low point was the 4 of us being "shooed" by the kitchen maid from a table for 4 to a tiny table really only big enough for 2, only to have the other table sit empty while we ate. Not sure what that was about, and she literally shooed us with hand gestures and a frown, so we just ate out in quaint cafes instead.
reviews.title: Very quaintly French, in style and attitude. Worth every Euro.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To begin, you CANNOT beat this hotel's location in the 7th. It's about a six to eight minute walk to the metro, and you could not leave the area and be completely content. The neighborhood is STELLAR!
reviews.title: Unbeatable location, small rooms, stellar service!

reviews.text: The staff at Londres Eiffel are uniformly helpful and polite. We had a couple odds and ends problems with the room that were addressed promptly. Staff are more than fluent in English (and tolerated my attempts to speak high-school French).
reviews.title: great location, nice small rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel rooms are clean and small--apparently the building housed former construction workers on the Eiffel Tower--and the facilities and amenities are standard. Nothing to knock your socks off here, but up-to-date.
reviews.title: Excellent Location, Adequate Room, Weird Keycard Rule

reviews.text: This is the friendliest hotel I've ever stayed in in Paris. We had a beautiful room with plenty of space (except possibly in the bathroom - it was lovely but no room for toiletries). We didn't opt for breakfast (there is a wonderful little patisserie right around the corner) but it looked very nice. People at the front desk were helpful. There is a great little restaurant (Cafe Constant) right around the corner - perfect for that first night when you're feeling jet lagged. About 3-4 blocks from the nearest metro, we had no problem getting around. And of course the Eiffel Tower is right there, which thrilled my daughter to no end. If you want to stay in the 7th, this is a great choice.
reviews.title: Friendly, cozy place in the 7th

reviews.text: My client stayed at this hotel and loved it, servie winderful and so friendly, would highly recommend
reviews.title: Very warm hotel

reviews.text: Reading the other reviews I wondered did we stay in the same hotel? While the lobby is nice. The people that work there were nice I did have some serious problems with the hotel. You are no allowed to bring ANY food into the hotel. So all the lovely fruit stands etc you pass you can not bring anything in. No stops at the pastry shop for treats, no wine in your room etc. See the pics of the nice tables in the breakfast room? Don't even think about maybe a night snack there. You are not allowed to eat there except if you pay for their breakfast.
reviews.title: Quirky Rules made me feel we were staying in a hostel

reviews.text: We had to hide our snacks and then throw them away wrapped up to hide it in our rooms. I would guess they must have a rodent problem? I did not see any but can not think of any other reason? I have stayed at hotels all over the world and have never been told this before. Felt like I was in a hostel.
reviews.title: Excellent accommodations and hospitality

reviews.text: Also I hear they have large rooms. Ours was a match box which I know is normal for Paris but there was no room to put luggage. They have these little closet things to "hold" your luggage. My daughter and I had the size just over a carry on and they would not fit in these. Half the room was taken up by a fridge which I have no idea why it is there since you can not bring food into your room?
reviews.title: Wonderful boutique hotel!

reviews.text: The experience of staying in this hotel is nothing short of perfect. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The accomodations are clean, comfortable, and charming. The location of Hotel Londres-Eiffel is great for site seeing, for shopping, for sipping a vin rouge in the shadow of the Eiffel Tower. You can never get lost because the East Pillar of the Eiffel Tower, which is visible from almost anywhere, always lets you know where your home away from home is. I definitely will go back.
reviews.title: Classy hotel

reviews.text: Simply stated.....everything was LOVELY.....everything....we're not even waiting a whole year to return....
reviews.title: Lovely

reviews.text: We are a family of 2 adults and 3 kids aged 11, 13 and 15. We stayed for four nights at this hotel at the beginning of August, 2006.
reviews.title: Highly Recommend

reviews.text: We found it through Trip Advisor, and so it is only fair that I write a review after staying there. Everything I had read on Trip Advisor turned out to be true and we have a great experience at the hotel.
reviews.title: Charming little hotel

likes.disliked: — Not much of a view from our room

reviews.text: Arnaud was terrific and extremely helpful. The hotel has an elevator, however, the rooms that we were given were not accessible by elevator. Arnaud carried every piece of our 9 pieces of luggage up two flights of stairs for us. When we left, Arnaud was off that day, however we had help bringing the luggage down from the gentleman on duty at the time (his name escapes me right now)
reviews.title: Fabulous value

reviews.text: Stayed here in July during a heat wave. We were happy that the room had air conditioning. Before arriving they had offered a cot for our baby but when we arrived there was an extra bed and no cot. To be fair with did not complain about this, since we found it easier for our son to sleep with us, so we don't know what they would have done had we done so. Our room was on a second floor but the only way to get ther was through a dark staircase that had some winding and weird steps, there was no lift in that area of the hotel. To get to other rooms there was a lift available. On our arrival we were helped to get our heavy suitcases to the room but on departure it was up to us to carry them down the stairs. The breakfast was very poor and had very little choices, I think this is the way it is in most french hotels so it's probably not a particular problem to this one. The ladies who served breakfast spoke nothing but french, so if your french is not too good you might be in a bit of trouble. The reception staff was not particularly helpful to us. I agree with another reviewer who wrote that they cater to USA tourist here so that might have been the problem since we're not Americans. The location is the best thing about this hotel. There are also several restaurants in the area as well as 2 laundrymats and a supermarket just around the corner. They also have free wi-fe internet access which was a plus. If you want a place close to the Eiffel Tower stay here but be sure to ask for a room with lift access. If the location is not an issue for you I'm sure that there are better places you can find.
reviews.title: Good enough hotel
Very nice, pleasant hotel, well-located
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here as part of the Rick Steves' one-week tour of Paris. The hotel was very nice and clean. The rooms are small, but nicely kept. Bathroom was larger than we expected, based on the other reviews we read. Nice shower, with excellent water pressure, room 35, on the third floor. Hotel has both a small elevator and stairs. Breakfast was nice, breads, cheese, fruit, yogurt, juices, coffee, etc.

reviews.title: A nice stay
reviews.text: Staff was very nice -- weather was in the 90s during three of the days we visited Paris, and the hotel was very nice to take care of my husband's request for ice each afternoon.

The hair dryer they provided did the job, and I did not have to unpack mine, and we also did not need the power adapter we brought, as the dryer unit also had a 110-volt US-style electrical plug, which we used for charging my husband's shaver and camera battery.
reviews.title: Surprised by all the great reviews
A great hotel!
reviews.text: I don't think we could have had a better location for a hotel...it is located close to everything, but also enjoys the benefit of being on a quiet street.

We had a wonderful two day stay at the Hotel de Londres Eiffel. The location was great with only a short walk to the Eiffel tower. The metro and bus stops were also close. The staff were very helpful with buses, taxis and directions.
reviews.title: Great location and value

reviews.text: My husband and I decided to celebrate our 30th Wedding Anniversary in Paris. What a fabulous celebration it turned out to be! Upon our arrival at the hotel we found it to be quite charming. Arnaud greeted us warmly and directed us to our 6th floor room with a wonderful view of the Eiffel Tower. The room was quite small but immaculate. You have to understand that all hotel rooms (except the very expensive ones) are usually small. The mattress on the queen size bed was extremely comfortable. Our bathroom was a nice size and extremely clean. The only downside was the tiny shower. You have to pray that you don’t drop the soap! But what does the size of the room and shower matter – you are in Paris!! The hotel was in a great location, especially for first time visitors. There were two bus stops very close to the hotel and we found that taking it was so easy. This way you get to see the sights instead of being underground in the subway. Every amenity you could possibly want was within a few blocks. There were grocery stores, bakeries, dry cleaners, wine stores and restaurants all right outside the hotel doors. Rue Cler (the market shopping street) was only a few blocks away. Our favorite little bakery was just up the street on Rue St. Dominique. Every morning my husband and I went there for our café au lait and croissant. (M-M-M very delicious!) It was very charming and there were a few tables outdoors and inside. The prices were very reasonable. Almost every meal we had in Paris was excellent. We ventured out of the area we stayed in for every meal except the first night when we ate at the Le Fountaine de Mars which was just up the street from the hotel. It was very good and the people were very friendly. They didn’t mind at all that our French was not the best. My husband had a duck with a port wine sauce and I had a delicious salmon with lemon sauce. A few nights later we ate at another terrific Italian place called Casa Bini located in St. Germain. Ask to be seated upstairs where it is a little more romantic. For our 30th Anniversary dinner we decided to go to Le Grand Colbert (the restaurant where “Something’s Gotta Give” was filmed). It was absolutely beautiful and the food and service were excellent. We can’t wait to go back again. The profiteroles were to die for! On our last night in Paris we ate at another wonderful restaurant located on 73 rue de Seine in St. Germain called City Zen Café. It was a very tiny and cozy place with a spectacular roast duck breast with a plum sauce. I even thought it was delicious and I don’t really enjoy duck. The crème brulee was a let down though. The only meal that we thought was awful was at a restaurant I found in the Access Paris tour book. It was called Relais Due Massif Central and was located near the Bastille. The waiter was rude and it didn’t seem to matter that I had ordered steak because he decided that I had ordered veal and even though I ordered a banana tart he brought me chocolate cake instead. My husband ate the veal and said it was stringy and I thought the beef was very tough. Avoid this restaurant at all costs.
reviews.title: Manhattanites have excellent stay

reviews.text: Forget what people say about Parisians being rude. It generally just isn’t true. People went out of their way to be helpful. My husband was trying to purchase tickets in the metro for the bus and 2 young ladies helped him just at they were running to catch their train. All in all we can’t wait to go back again and wouldn’t hesitate to stay at the Hotel De Londres Eiffel again.
reviews.title: Loved our Stay

reviews.text: We recently spent four nights with our two children at this small hotel. We booked two rooms. The rooms have everything you need (air con, hair dryer, very clean, quiet), but are very small. The staff is extremely helpful and made excellent dinner reservations for us (our favorite was Le P'tit Troquet). The hotel is surrounded by great food shops, bakeries and restauants. There are also two laundrymats across the street which is especially important when traveling with children. It is an easy walk to the Eiffel Tower and to boat rides on the Seine. We loved to buy a picnic lunch from the local shops and and walk the couple of blocks to the Parc du Champs de Mars. We found it to be a lovely hotel in a quiet and convenient location.
reviews.title: Great location, great value.
Rick Steves Paris Tour Hotel
reviews.text: Stayed here on a tour of France. Rooms typically small and parisian, but well appointed and clean. The shower room was very clean and surprisingly big. Common parts not particulary spacious but loads to do nearby including the tower as others have mentioned. The market nearby is fantastic for fresh food, and people watching. And the confit de canard shop opposite is stunning.
Made a last min. change to the Hotel de Londres-Eiffel .What a excellent choice! Spotless rooms .Super location. And a wonderful staff! Arnaud who was on duty was Very helpful in making our
reviews.title: Everything was Great!
HOTEL LONDRES EIFFEL PARIS
reviews.text: Paris stay enjoyable helping set up tours. and let me add Perfect English! On our next trip

reviews.title: Decent place to stay near Eiffel Tower
reviews.text: to Paris we will stay at the Hotel de Londres-Effel. Thanks Arnaud and Cedric !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only had a chance to stay here for one night. Our last night in France. And it was wonderful. I wanted something charming and quant, very parisian for our last night. This was it. The hotel is a very nice and clean place. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was clean, a bit small but I think we've stayed in smaller rooms in NYC. The breakfast in the morning was a nice finish to the stay.
reviews.title: Smallish room but location was wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a lovely hotel in anice quiet street. It is two minutes away from the eiffel tower and there are plenty of nice restaurants to go to nearby. The staff were friendly and helpful not minding that we could speak very little french! They were very acoomodating to anything we asked . The rooms were sparkling clean and well decorated. Although it was small i felt that it just added to its cosiness.
reviews.title: Lovely small hotel, great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Downside was that there was building work going on in the room next to us which meant an early wake up of half eight every morning which we weren't warned about - just as well we were eager to get sightseeing.
reviews.title: Loved This Charming Place

likes.liked: — Value for money, beautiful decor, great location, comfort of rooms, friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was very small which was fine for me but a big of a squeeze for the other half who found the tiny bath a bit of an experience. Also like to be able to make tea and coffee in the room which we couldn't do.
reviews.title: 2nd Time Not As Good

reviews.text: This was our second time at this hotel. It has such wonderful Parisian charm! The decor is welcoming, cozy, and tasteful.
reviews.title: Perfect !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed two nights at Londres Eiffel and we were very pleased. Due to an, not surprisingly, sudden AirFrance pilot strike we arrived by car after midnight, but we had called the hotel earlier the same evening to inform them about our late arrival and this was no problem at all. Our room on the top floor was indeed small and had an odd smell of an old basement. Besides from the smell everything was fine and the bathroom was clean and there were plenty of towels. The first morning we had a café breakfast, but the second morning we decided to go for the hotel buffet breakfast and we were not disappointed, on the contrary, there was plenty to chose from and a bargin compared to a café breakfast. The staff was not overly friendly, but ok. The room was very quiet and the prize very low, thinking about the fantastic location. One night we had dinner at the tiny restaurant just next door, think it was called "Chez Alice" or something like it. Fun experience since the lady had had the place for years and she cooks, waits and does the dishes alone, all while her little dog lies on a chair among the guests.
reviews.title: Location is everything

likes.liked: — The location combined with the prize

reviews.text: I booked the hotel owing to the reviews on this website. Our stay was quite nice and there is a lot on the upside, but also some disappointments.
reviews.title: Ok, A Little Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel is very good situated in one of the most upscale neighborhoods of Paris. Many nice shops and restaurants are in a short walking distance, the area is not so crowded by tourists as many other areas we have seen. And the view of the Eiffel Tower on the way back to the Hotel after sightseeing or shopping is simply stunning.
reviews.title: Just what we needed

likes.disliked: — Nowhere to get a hot drink!

reviews.text: Our room was extremely small, but more or less comfortable and nice. The bed was ok and the bathroom as well.
reviews.title: Excellent Location

reviews.text: I guess we were just a little unlucky with our room, while cleaning i got a glimpse of other rooms and some of them looked much nicer. In a small Hotel like this i expect a more personal or more welcoming atmosphere.
reviews.title: Stay here if you go to Paris!

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel last year with a group of friends and found it to be very charming.
reviews.title: Charming hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is nicely maintained and decorated in a very quaint, Parisian style. As it is located so centrally, the rooms are quite small, but that's to be expected.
reviews.title: "Our whole experience was excellent"
A great place to stay in Paris
reviews.text: The staff were really very helpful and I would definitely stay there again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and myself wanted a completely different experience when it came to picking a hotel stay in Paris, we wanted a neighborhood feel, surrounded by cafe's centrally located to everything, we couldn't have picked a better spot, it was a very pleasant stay, everyone there made us feel at home and were very helpful to our needs, most of our contact was with arnaud and he couldn't have been more helpful, we were on an 18 day drive trip of Europe and this was by far our favorite stop, highly recommend this Hotel and Staff
reviews.title: Great location, and great people!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved the hotel's location and the bistro just down the street had great food and excellent service. The rooms are tiny but very clean and nicely decorated. We don't visit Paris to stay in our room. The staff are very nice and helpful.
reviews.title: Charming, romantic and stratigecally located ;)

reviews.text: This reasonably-priced and cozy hotel is in a wonderful quiet but thriving neighborhood, close to the Eiffel Tower and to the city center but far from the tourist hordes. The cafes and restaurants are in the area are excellent. Rooms were small but comfortable, and very quiet. Decor was very tasteful and almost all the front desk staff was helpful with multiple questions and directions. A great find!
reviews.title: Excellent Neighborhood, Warm Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for one night after spend a week with friends in the 5th. We really liked this hotel. The rooms were clean, modern and comfortable, and the location was perfect. It was an easy stroll to the Eiffel Tower, and Cafe Constant is a brilliant restaurant next door which had been recommended many times to us. The only problem we had was that we requested a shuttle to the airport the next morning and the concierge forgot to book it. However the staff the next morning went out of their way once they realised the error and made sure we got to the airport in time. Despite this small issue, we would definitely recommend it and would stay again.
reviews.title: Good location, nice hotel

reviews.text: We decided to book a last minute trip to Paris for a weekend in November and was very lucky to have found this cute boutique hotel, right next to the Eiffel Tower! We were traveling with a one year (which can always be a little challenging) and from the moment we arrived the staff did everything they could to make our stay as stress free as possible. They gave us milk, let us use their fridge for the baby's food, and even gave us a late check out so the baby could finish her nap. In addition, operating from the front desk, Arno was the BEST tour guide. There wasn't a question he did could not answer and directed us, on more then one occasion, to the best places! The rooms were nice and quiet (we were on the first floor) and the beds were comfortable. There was a great bakery just down the street and it was within walking distant from the metro. When I return to Paris, I will stay here without a doubt. The staff made our first Paris experience very enjoyable...thank you!!
reviews.title: Perfect Location and Amazing Staff

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel 3 years ago with 5 friends and was impressed with this (I believe a family) Hotel.
reviews.title: 100% Plus..location, service and accomodation

reviews.text: This fall I was travelling with my adult son and heading home from Kenya to Canada.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Hotel de Londres Eiffel for 5 nights in May and had a wonderful time. Arnaud greeted us when we arrived and spent time with us to orient ourselves with the city as this was our first visit to Paris. He gave us wonderful tips during our stay. The hotel is on a lovely quiet street in the 7th district. A very short walk to the Eiffel tower with many restaurants, transportation, bakeries and stores at our door step. The first night of our stay, we were offered a room with the view of the Eiffel tower and it truly was a magical experience - one that I would recommend if you can. The rooms we stayed in were decorated in such a beautiful Parisian design - it really added to the experience. The staff of the hotel were all so helpful and friendly and went out of their way to make our stay a great. We would definitely stay here again upon our next visit to Paris!
reviews.title: Beautiful Boutique Hotel in a Wonderful Location of Paris!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here in January and will definitely book this hotel for future stays.
reviews.title: Very enjoyable stay

reviews.text: It is excellently located in a very nice neighbourhood. Upon arrival, we were greeted by a very friendly receptionist who upgraded us for free to the room with the view of the Eiffel Tower, saying it was a shame for it to be empty - how great!!
reviews.title: Great people

reviews.text: The breakfast was basic but perfectly sufficient for starting a day of sightseeing. Only a few minutes walk to the Eiffel Tower and the Seine. The open top bus tours also stop around 10 minutes away.
reviews.title: Charming Boutique Hotel

reviews.text: The area has lots of excellent restaurants, bakeries etc. We particularly enjoyed FL restaurant (right next door) as well as a meal at Cafe Constant down the road.
reviews.title: Gem by the Eiffel Tower

reviews.text: I was at the hotel in April 2012, and found the location and price, and service excellent. This April 2013 I visited Paris with my daughter for a week. The room again was faultless, and they organized a twin room with no fuss. The staff were friendly and helpful, and had great recommendations for restaurants. Although with Rue Cler so close you are spoiled for choice when it comes to food! 5 minutes to the Eiffel Tower, 10 minutes by bus to the Louvre, or 20 minutes walk (which is more fun interesting), the hotel is in a great location for tourists.
reviews.title: Second visit, just as good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for 10 nights this past month. While small, the rooms are neat, clean, comfortable, and stylish. Very quiet; slept very weel every night. The staff was always helpful, and the included daily breakfast was a highlight of each day we were in Paris. We were just a few blocks from the Eiffel Tower, Rue Cler, and a 15 minute walk to the Ecole Militaire Metro station. Excellent cafes and restaurants abound within a block or two. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Cherished Memory; Superb Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Steve H.
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel!!

reviews.text: We just returned from a trip to Paris and just loved this hotel! The location of the hotel couldn't be better, the staff is absolutely wonderful and go out of their way to make your stay the best it can be. The room was very clean and nice. We stayed on the 6th floor and had a view of the Eiffel Tower - best night light ever!! Highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Perfect Location, Perfect Hosts - the Place is Just - Well - Perfect!

reviews.text: My daughter moved to Grenoble, France two years ago and my wife and I planned a visit in April 2013 to meet my granddaughter, While there we decided to stay three days in Paris. I had no idea where anything was in Paris, never having been there, much less any idea where to stay. I used TripAdvisor and found the Hotel de Londres Eiffel, took a chance and booked it primarily for it's location and proximity to the Eiffel Tower.
reviews.title: GREAT LOCATION, NOISY DUE TO CONSTRUCTION

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at Hotel de Londres Eiffel for 3 nights in between Christmas and New Year 2011. We had booked a cheap (185 euro per night) standard double room but we were kindly upgraded to a room on the 5th floor with a view of the top of the Eiffel Tower - a lovely surprise.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was small but very clean and beautifully decorated. The bed was very comfy and the small shower/toilet room perfectly adequate. I don't think the hotel has a restaurant, and breakfast was not included in the price. I suppose this could be called a 'boutique' hotel which really means you get a room and nothing else - but when you're in Paris you dont spend a great deal of time hanging around your hotel!
reviews.title: Fabulous stay under the Eiffel Tower!

reviews.text: The location is one of the main highlights - it is located round across the road from a mid-sized supermarket, and just round the corner from a busy street containing a bakers, many restaurants, pharmacy etc. But the main attraction is the Eiffel Tower - visible from the higher floors of the hotel, and a short 3/4 minute walk away.
reviews.title: Would stay again.

reviews.text: Nearest Metro station is Ecole Militaire, which is a 7/8 minute walk away from the Eiffel Tower. With a metro station so close it gives you access to all of the main Paris attractions within 20 minutes.
reviews.title: top location - lovely staff

reviews.text: A fantastic, fairly cheap hotel and one I would certainly recommend to couples.
reviews.title: Impeccable! Really enjoyed my stay there!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband booked this hotel online for about 80 euros per night and once we arrived, I was shocked by the great find! The room, though small, was cozy, cute and warm. It had a flat screen tv, desk, and two small wardrobes on either side of the bed. The bed was comfortable.
reviews.title: Great value in Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom was also small, but sufficient. We had a towel warming rack which was very convenient on the cold winter days. Toiletries are provided which was very nice.
reviews.title: Excellent location, friendly hotel

reviews.text: Our room rate included breakfast which consisted of croissants and baguettes, juice, cereal, yogurt and the like...a typical hotel breakfast in Europe.
reviews.title: Great value, service, location in the heart of Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The most fabulous part about the hotel is its proximity to the Eiffel Tower. It was about a 10 minute walk from the hotel and for that kind of location I am surprised we weren't paying more. The staff wasn't very helpful in the way of restaurant recommendations which was a little bothersome, but no that big of a deal because we had free internet in the room and could search for restaurants. Overall, great stay, great price and great value. I would highly recommend this property especially if you can get it at a discounted rate like we did.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent 3 star hotel. My wife and I stayed 3 nights after reading all of the reviews on Trip Advisor. Small room, but very clean, and well presented. Supermarket about 1 minute around the corner, and the Eiffel Tower a 10 minute walk down the Champs de Mars. The absolute find was the restaurant next door (Chez Agnes), and if you are lucky you will get a table. Would recommend this hotel to anyone - the only reason it is not 4 star is because it does not have all the fancy facilities.
reviews.title: What a Gem?

likes.liked: — locationm, cleanliness, comfort of room, friendliness of staff, value
likes.disliked: — Nothing--except I wish we could have stayed longer!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It has been a wonderful holiday and their amiability made our stay one of the best I remember in any other hotel. Their kindness and attention was impressive.
reviews.title: The best of París

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are clean, normal size for Paris. We had a problem with the reservation (our fault) we reserved a night less than we should have and they reserved a room in another hotel in case they didnt have one for us in their hotel, they took care of everything.
reviews.title: Cozy place in fantastic location

reviews.text: I was very pleased with the extraordinary treatment received by the gentlemen at the front desk during the day and night (I’m sorry I don’t know their names).
reviews.title: Exceptional Value

reviews.text: I have no doubt I will stay there again in next visits and will recommend it to everybody.
reviews.title: Cozy and nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Un saludo desde España,
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location
Very French
reviews.text: Hotel Londres Eiffel is a very nice hotel. We stayed there recently and will definitely stay there again when we are in Paris. It was peaceful and quiet. We wondered if anyone else was staying there-they were. It gives on a small narrow street. The nice gentleman at the desk accommodated us with a request we made for a room with the view of the Eiffel Tower. We had a good laugh when we opened the window: we could only see the very top of it! But we didn't mind because we could walk over and see it's lighted spendor in the evening with its blue and white lights twinkling. The room was small but very comfortable:a small desk, a small closet on each side of the bed sufficient for 2 people. We slept in a large and comfortable queen size bed. The bathroom is modern and very clean but quite small. We had a shower stall and I'm glad that I lost 5 lbs before our trip. If you are tall and a little overweight ask for a tub. I would have given the hotel 5 stars but I gave it only 4 because of the size of the bathroom. The hotel is near Rue Cler: a pedestrian street filled with cafes,boutiques and a dry cleaner who will do a large wash for the modest sum of 10 Euros and no shrinkage. Au Bon Marche on Rue Cler is a bistrot that serves very good food at reasonnable prices. The people working there are very nice and friendly. The metro stop for the hotel is Ecole Militaire. If you stop at La Motte Piquet you will have a long walk but that's nice too if you're not too tired.Bon Voyage

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I visited Paris for the first time in September and we pretty much got what we expected at this hotel. The room was small but clean with a nice bathroom. We had a room with a view of the Effiel Tower which was really pretty, especially at night.
reviews.title: Great Location, Only the Basics

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only surprise we had came at checkout, when we found out that the daily breakfast service is not included with the price of the room. Probably would have opted for local fare had we known.
reviews.title: Just what I wanted

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this hotel mostly for its location which proved to be wonderful. The neighborhood offers a nice choice of restaurants, shops and cafes and the Metro is only a brief walk away (10 minutes). We really felt safe in this residential neighborhood at all hours.
reviews.title: Great little place - a bit overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel for sleeping and honeymooning. It has great location, it is comfortable, it is quiet. Staff is friendly and helpfull. Wifi is free and Eifel tower is just outside. Will come again!
reviews.title: Perfect for a romantic weekend in Paris ....

description: Independent charming hotel, L'Hotel de Londres Eiffel offers you 30 rooms all equipped with air conditioning with bathroom wc, or shower wc. We are situated at 2 minutes by walk from the Eiffel tower, near rue Cler, near Invalides. Some of our rooms have a view on the Eiffel tower.
